title: I am a beginner in UPSC Civil Service preparation and wanted to know the basic books required besides the ncerts to clear IAS? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Well, considering the new pattern of CSE, the demand is not only about reading basic books and learning new concepts. Now everything is about learning new concepts and applying them at the same time through answer writing.You can get the required book list from any of the websites or from your friends. However, you should start doing 'smart-work' rather than just reading books. Few points: 1. Link to whatever you're reading/studying with the UPSC syllabus. Let's say, if you're reading any article about 'Smart City' then you should link that with the required syllabus. Your mind should work like 'Smart City' -> GS1 -> Urbanization. This way you can integrate your studies effectively. 2. Use internet websites like Insightsonindia, IASBABA, Vision IAS, Mrunal, Unacademy, etc. these websites provide quality content which will help you to understand the concepts well. 3. Don't just restrict yourself to reading books and newspapers. Start writing answers on InsightsonIndia. The moment you feel a little confident then join a decent test series. Testing yourself through 'test series' is indispensable these days. 4. Align your studies for both prelims and mains. Never prepare only for 'prelims' considering that you'll cover the required syllabus of 'mains' after clearing the prelims. 5. Have patience and enjoy this process. Stop talking to those who discourage you. It's all about perseverance. So, work hard and try to strengthen your strengths and weaken your weaknesses. Last but definitely not the least, remember the idea of 'Nishkama Karma' of Bhagwad Gita -Actions are our sphere, fruits are not our concern. All the best!

As I am working I will give my preparation strategy here, this is just an example, and you can have your own based on your strength and weaknesses… As I am working, I hardly devote 3-4hrs per day for preparation. below link may give some insight. Vinayak Manoji's answer to How do I prepare for the civil service exam while working a 9am-7pm job? ) Some general instructions 1.	Go through syllabus and get familiar with it. 2.	List down the subjects like, history, geo, economy, polity etc 3.	List down the books for each subjects. (keep book list as minimum as possible, don’t read multiple  books for same source of information) I have seen many people will read multiple books to get wide information but as we are working we don’t have that much flexibility. What we can do is read same book multiple times.  4.	Go through previous year prelims/mains questions before starting any subject, extend it for all subjects.
